page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: The town of{Bury}situated about 14km. north of{Manchester}lies broadly in the valley of the{River Irwell. {Bury}is a{Metropolitan Borough}of about 175,000 people and is the chief town of the district, which stretches from the{Pennine Moors}in the north to within 7km. of{Manchester}City Centre in the south. {Bury}developed as a market town in the 15th century, but its main growth was during the{industrial revolution}when textiles became its main industrial base. Since then there has been a great diversification, particularly as a shopping centre. The borough is noted for its{market, {black puddings,and}famous sons,{Sir {Robert Peel}and{John Kay,(inventor of {the Flying Shuttle). { {
